üõ† Gi·∫£i ph√°p: D√πng Python convert HTML ‚Üí Markdown C√≥ 2 th∆∞ vi·ªán c·ª±c ti·ªán:
1. html2text ‚Äî d·ªÖ x√†i, c√†i 1 ph√°t l√† chi·∫øn pip install html2text import html2text html = "<b>Hello</b> <a href='https://example.com'>Click me</a>" markdown = html2text.html2text(html) print(markdown) # **Hello** [Click me](https://example.com) markdownify ‚Äî x·ªãn h∆°n, t√πy ch·ªânh m·∫°nh pip install markdownify from markdownify import markdownify as md html = "<h1>Title</h1><p>This is <b>bold</b></p>" markdown = md(html) print(markdown) # # Title # This is **bold** ‚ú® T·∫°i sao n√™n d√πng? Slack kh√¥ng h·ªó tr·ª£ HTML ‚áí c·∫ßn Markdown Hugo vi·∫øt b√†i c≈©ng d√πng Markdown L√†m vi·ªác nhanh h∆°n, ƒë·ª° s·ª≠a tay
üéØ Tip nh·ªè D√πng strip() sau khi convert ƒë·ªÉ lo·∫°i b·ªè d√≤ng tr·ªëng: md = html2text.html2text(html).strip()
summary:
Trong m·ªôt s·ªë t√¨nh hu·ªëng nh∆∞:

  • B·∫°n ƒëang l·∫•y n·ªôi dung HTML t·ª´ email ho·∫∑c web
  • Mu·ªën d√°n n√≥ l√™n Slack cho g·ªçn g√†ng
  • Ho·∫∑c mu·ªën paste v√¥ Hugo ƒë·ªÉ vi·∫øt blog m√† kh√¥ng b·ªã l·ªói format

Th√¨ Markdown l√† chu·∫©n nh·∫•t. Nh∆∞ng convert b·∫±ng tay th√¨ m·ªát. V·∫≠y th√¨…

üõ† Gi·∫£i ph√°p: D√πng Python convert HTML ‚Üí Markdown

C√≥ 2 th∆∞ vi·ªán c·ª±c ti·ªán:

1. html2text ‚Äî d·ªÖ x√†i, c√†i 1 ph√°t l√† chi·∫øn

pip install html2text
import html2text

  1. markdownify ‚Äî x·ªãn h∆°n, t√πy ch·ªânh m·∫°nh

Khi l√†m vi·ªác v·ªõi d·ªØ li·ªáu JSON t·ª´ nhi·ªÅu ngu·ªìn, ch·∫Øc ch·∫Øn b·∫°n t·ª´ng g·∫∑p c·∫£nh key kh√¥ng ƒë·ªìng nh·∫•t nh∆∞:
{ "tTien": 1000, "ttien": 1000, "tthue": 100, "tThue": 100, "TThue": 100 } M·ªói n∆°i ƒë·∫∑t t√™n m·ªói ki·ªÉu, kh√≥ x·ª≠ l√Ω. N·∫øu c·ª© try/except, if/else hay match/case th√¨ code s·∫Ω lo·∫±ng ngo·∫±ng v√† d·ªÖ l·ªói.
Gi·∫£i ph√°p g·ªçn nh·∫π Tr∆∞·ªõc khi x·ª≠ l√Ω, convert h·∫øt key v·ªÅ lowercase. C·ª±c nhanh v√† d·ªÖ maintain: data = {k.lower(): v for k, v in original_data.items()} Gi·ªù th√¨ ch·ªâ c·∫ßn data['ttien'], data['tthue'] th√¥i, kh·ªèi lo vi·∫øt d√†i d√≤ng.
Bonus N·∫øu key c√≥ d·∫•u c√°ch ho·∫∑c d·∫•u g·∫°ch (-, _), c√≥ th·ªÉ normalize th√™m:
import re def normalize_key(k): return re.sub(r'\W+', '', k).lower() data = {normalize_key(k): v for k, v in original_data.items()}

ƒê·ªÉ tr√°nh l·ªói hi·ªÉn th·ªã, h√£y chuy·ªÉn ch√∫ng nh∆∞ sau:
> ‚Üí &gt; < ‚Üí &lt; <= ‚Üí &lt;= >= ‚Üí &gt;= & ‚Üí &amp; V√≠ d·ª• code hi·ªÉn th·ªã ƒë√∫ng:

Khi vi·∫øt blog, b·∫°n c√≥ th·ªÉ c·∫ßn d√πng c√°c k√Ω t·ª± nh∆∞ >, <, <=, >=, &.

ƒê·ªÉ tr√°nh l·ªói hi·ªÉn th·ªã, h√£y chuy·ªÉn ch√∫ng nh∆∞ sau:

content:
B·∫°n mu·ªën chuy·ªÉn repo t·ª´ GitLab sang GitHub m√† gi·ªØ to√†n b·ªô commit, branch v√† tag? ƒê√¢y l√† c√°ch si√™u g·ªçn üëá
#!/bin/bash # Replace these with your info GITLAB_REPO="https://gitlab.com/yourname/your-repo.git" GITHUB_REPO="https://github.com/yourname/your-repo.git" # Clone from GitLab git clone --mirror "$GITLAB_REPO" cd your-repo.git # Push to GitHub (with all history + branches + tags) git remote set-url origin "$GITHUB_REPO" git push --mirror # Done! echo "‚úÖ Repo migrated from GitLab to GitHub!"
summary: C√°ch chuy·ªÉn repo t·ª´ GitLab sang GitHub (ho·∫∑c ng∆∞·ª£c l·∫°i) m√† gi·ªØ nguy√™n l·ªãch s·ª≠, branch, tag ch·ªâ v·ªõi v√†i d√≤ng l·ªánh bash.
title: Tip Move Repo Gitlab Github

content:
Ghost is one of the best platforms for beginners who wanna start blogging fast. Below is a simple docker-compose.yml setup to get you going right away:
services: ghost: image: ghost container_name: ghost ports: - "2368:2368" environment: - NODE_ENV=development - database__connection__filename=/var/lib/ghost/content/data/ghost.db - url=http://localhost:2368 volumes: - ./ghost-data:/var/lib/ghost/content
summary:
Ghost is one of the best platforms for beginners who wanna start blogging fast. Below is a simple docker-compose.yml setup to get you going right away:

services:
  ghost:
    image: ghost
    container_name: ghost
    ports:
      - "2368:2368"
    environment:
      - NODE_ENV=development
      - database__connection__filename=/var/lib/ghost/content/data/ghost.db
      - url=http://localhost:2368
    volumes:
      - ./ghost-data:/var/lib/ghost/content
title: Deploy Ghost With Docker
